document.title: Ohio's New Learning Standards: K-12 World Languages

11819A10DFE701310EDB68A86D17958E.description: Develop an understanding that people in other cultures might view aspects of U.S. mainstream culture differently than the majority of U.S. residents view them.

118145B0DFE701310EDA68A86D17958E.description: Identify and begin using appropriate levels of formality or informality when interacting with members of the target culture(s).

1180FF30DFE701310ED968A86D17958E.description: Interact with target language speakers around common interests.

1180B780DFE701310ED868A86D17958E.description: Develop awareness of and experience target community organizations and their resources.

11806FA0DFE701310ED768A86D17958E.description: Use authentic digital and print media.

118028C0DFE701310ED668A86D17958E.description: Identify, describe and create replicas of important objects, images and symbols.

117FDCC0DFE701310ED568A86D17958E.description: Experience and react to simple expressive products.

117F8B80DFE701310ED468A86D17958E.description: Attend, view or participate in cross-cultural activities and target culture events.

117F3F90DFE701310ED368A86D17958E.description: Experience the target language and culture(s) and share information or personal reactions with others.

117EF1E0DFE701310ED268A86D17958E.description: Begin using basic global competency skills online and/or in person to build positive collaborative relationships with peers and others.

117E2C10DFE701310ED068A86D17958E.description: Solve basic problems and complete simple tasks while learning to recognize and consider different cultural perspectives.

117DD9C0DFE701310ECF68A86D17958E.description: Recognize cultural perspectives as they are portrayed in the media and other sources.

117D9610DFE701310ECE68A86D17958E.description: Identify basic variations in products, practices and perspectives among target language communities.

117D50E0DFE701310ECD68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that languages and cultures interact with, influence or change each other over time.

117D0C20DFE701310ECC68A86D17958E.description: Identify and name/list major institutions, contemporary and historical figures, contributions and time periods of the target culture(s).

117CC5C0DFE701310ECB68A86D17958E.description: Identify examples of how the availability of products and services is not always uniform across cultures.

117C7A20DFE701310ECA68A86D17958E.description: Identify and compare products, practices and perspectives of the U.S. and target cultures.

117C2A20DFE701310EC968A86D17958E.description: Identify how people may meet their basic needs in different ways.

117BE3D0DFE701310EC868A86D17958E.description: Recognize and imitate patterns of behavior.

117B9A30DFE701310EC768A86D17958E.description: Identify relationships among common products, practices and perspectives and compare them across cultures.

comments: Gain and use knowledge and understanding of other cultures.

117B05B0DFE701310EC568A86D17958E.description: Use basic visuals and sound to enhance simple performances.

117AB9A0DFE701310EC468A86D17958E.description: Write and perform a simple, original rhyme, story, poem, song, skit or dance.

117A5690DFE701310EC368A86D17958E.description: Play music or produce an art/craft of the target culture and share basic information about it with others.

1179F880DFE701310EC268A86D17958E.description: Dramatize or perform authentic songs, dances, skits or plays containing memorized or highly practiced phrases with appropriate body movements.

1179A710DFE701310EC168A86D17958E.description: Recite or retell adapted short stories, folktales, poems and rhymes containing memorized or highly practiced phrases with appropriate body movements.

11795F20DFE701310EC068A86D17958E.description: Present simple literary, creative and artistic endeavors to audiences near or far.

1178FC80DFE701310EBF68A86D17958E.description: Synthesize basic interdisciplinary information and content to create and present simple reports, presentations and/or projects.

117898E0DFE701310EBE68A86D17958E.description: Create and present a simple persuasive statement in support of or against an issue of shared concern.

117856C0DFE701310EBD68A86D17958E.description: Advise others about an option, idea, plan or perspective using simple language.

11781140DFE701310EBC68A86D17958E.description: Propose solutions to a simple issue or problem.

1177CAF0DFE701310EBB68A86D17958E.description: Motivate a peer to meet or exceed a personal or shared goal.

11778380DFE701310EBA68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and name common products and services and promote favorites to an audience of peers and/or family members.

11772B30DFE701310EB968A86D17958E.description: Publicize an event, program or recent success by providing basic details in simple terms.

1176E4C0DFE701310EB868A86D17958E.description: Provide or demonstrate basic rules, regulations and/or policies.

1176A080DFE701310EB768A86D17958E.description: Explain a simple process or concept.

11765B60DFE701310EB668A86D17958E.description: Describe people, places or things in simple terms to educate or entertain others.

117616D0DFE701310EB568A86D17958E.description: Tell a simple personal story or anecdote.

1175D0D0DFE701310EB468A86D17958E.description: Create and present simple lists and classifications.

11758460DFE701310EB368A86D17958E.description: Present information, concepts and viewpoints on familiar topics from across disciplines.

11752A40DFE701310EB268A86D17958E.description: Develop awareness of the need to cite sources and avoid plagiarism.

1174D7C0DFE701310EB168A86D17958E.description: Rehearse presentations using simple delivery strategies.

11748A20DFE701310EB068A86D17958E.description: Produce final drafts/presentations with aesthetic appeal using tools that help to convey meaning.

117445E0DFE701310EAF68A86D17958E.description: Revise and edit texts/presentations using tools that focus attention on meaning, form and mechanics.

117400E0DFE701310EAE68A86D17958E.description: Produce initial drafts/presentations while keeping audience, context and purpose in mind.

11735F90DFE701310EAC68A86D17958E.description: Plan basic texts and presentations by brainstorming ideas and choosing vocabulary, phrases and sentence patterns.

11730430DFE701310EAB68A86D17958E.description: Convey simple meaning using writing processes and presentation strategies.

comments: Learners present information, concepts, ideas and viewpoints on a variety of topics to audiences of listeners, readers or viewers for varied purposes. Learners demonstrate linguistic and cultural competence through academic endeavors, creative undertakings and artistic expression. Learners use their understanding of culture to convey messages in a manner that facilitates interpretation by others where no direct opportunity for the active negotiation of meaning exists.

11726B40DFE701310EA968A86D17958E.description: Give simple advice to a peer or family member and consider how to adjust advice, if necessary, based on his/her emotional response or counterargument.

11722360DFE701310EA868A86D17958E.description: Give and react to opinions and share basic preferences on familiar personal and academic topics.

1171DAF0DFE701310EA768A86D17958E.description: Ask and answer simple questions about feelings, emotions and preferences.

117181B0DFE701310EA668A86D17958E.description: Express basic feelings and emotions in reaction to an announcement, a surprise or an event.

11713590DFE701310EA568A86D17958E.description: Express preferences, feelings, emotions and opinions about familiar topics.

1170E030DFE701310EA468A86D17958E.description: Collaborate to accomplish simple tasks or to propose solutions to simple problems affecting local and global communities.

11709650DFE701310EA368A86D17958E.description: Provide basic information or services using knowledge of the target language and culture.

117045D0DFE701310EA268A86D17958E.description: Use language to acquire basic goods, services or information.

116FF470DFE701310EA168A86D17958E.description: Initiate, carry on and conclude short, simple conversations and interviews on basic personal, general knowledge, academic and interdisciplinary topics and issues.

116F8680DFE701310EA068A86D17958E.description: Share simple descriptions of people, places, things and events.

116F42B0DFE701310E9F68A86D17958E.description: Give and follow sequences of simple directions, requests or instructions to engage in basic social, educational and cultural tasks and activities.

116EFF20DFE701310E9E68A86D17958E.description: Ask and answer simple questions on personal and familiar topics.

116EBA20DFE701310E9D68A86D17958E.description: Engage in greetings, introductions and leave-taking.

116E73F0DFE701310E9C68A86D17958E.description: Interact with others using culturally appropriate language and gestures on familiar topics.

116E29C0DFE701310E9B68A86D17958E.description: Use simple conversation strategies to steer interactions.

116DD8B0DFE701310E9A68A86D17958E.description: Observe or use simple nonverbal clues to help clarify meaning.

116D8A00DFE701310E9968A86D17958E.description: Ask simple questions to seek clarification.

116CFDA0DFE701310E9768A86D17958E.description: Use simple expressions to make requests and seek clarification.

116CB7D0DFE701310E9668A86D17958E.description: Negotiate meaning using simple requests, clarifications and conversation strategies.

comments: Learners initiate and sustain meaningful spoken, written and signed communication by providing and obtaining information, expressing feelings and emotions, and exchanging opinions in culturally appropriate ways. Learners actively negotiate meaning across languages and cultures to ensure that their messages are understood and that they can understand others.

1169EC40DFE701310E8D68A86D17958E.description: Identify common literary genres and classify short literary pieces by genre.

1169A970DFE701310E8C68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate understanding by participating in moderated discussions about aspects of short literary pieces.

11696380DFE701310E8B68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate comprehension of key elements of literary texts through the creation of simple artistic and/or technology-enhanced representations.

11691B70DFE701310E8A68A86D17958E.description: Predict the outcome of a story or fable.

1168CA80DFE701310E8968A86D17958E.description: Provide simple descriptions of characters and settings.

11688290DFE701310E8868A86D17958E.description: Sequence events in familiar children's stories.

11683650DFE701310E8768A86D17958E.description: Answer simple questions about literary texts.

1167CA70DFE701310E8668A86D17958E.description: Comprehend and interpret basic information about the main idea and relevant details in authentic literary texts.

116771C0DFE701310E8568A86D17958E.description: Use basic information from authentic sources to solve simple problems, complete basic tasks or reinforce concepts across the curriculum.

11672850DFE701310E8468A86D17958E.description: Draw simple conclusions based on the most important ideas and details derived from authentic messages and informational texts.

1166DB40DFE701310E8368A86D17958E.description: Identify the essential elements of written informational texts and use them to identify the main idea and basic details.

11669560DFE701310E8268A86D17958E.description: Identify, arrange and sort people, places, things or events based on simple descriptions.

11664F00DFE701310E8168A86D17958E.description: Answer simple questions about authentic messages and informational texts

11660530DFE701310E8068A86D17958E.description: Follow simple instructions, directions and requests.

1165BD90DFE701310E7F68A86D17958E.description: Comprehend and interpret basic information in authentic messages and informational texts.

11657490DFE701310E7E68A86D17958E.description: Use basic information and viewpoints from authentic sources to inform or enhance a simple conversation, presentation or expression of creativity.

11651FF0DFE701310E7D68A86D17958E.description: Examine a topic, event or viewpoint as it is presented in different authentic sources and determine if it is treated similarly or differently across those sources.

1164D810DFE701310E7C68A86D17958E.description: Recognize the viewpoint of an authentic source by identifying who produced the text, when, why and for whom.

11648D70DFE701310E7B68A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between authentic and non-authentic sources by identifying the unique characteristics of each.

11643A30DFE701310E7A68A86D17958E.description: Develop an understanding that authentic sources convey viewpoints and learn to use authentic sources critically.

116C1F20DFE701310E9468A86D17958E.description: Interpret gestures, intonation and tone to comprehend simple verbal and nonverbal messages.

116BD650DFE701310E9368A86D17958E.description: Use knowledge of the situation, the purpose of communication or context cues to understand simple messages.

116B8710DFE701310E9268A86D17958E.description: Gain and utilize knowledge of word families/characters and cognates to figure out the meaning of new words and expressions.

116B2DF0DFE701310E9168A86D17958E.description: Make use of print and digital resources to understand the meaning of new words and expressions.

116AC9E0DFE701310E9068A86D17958E.description: Understand new words, phrases or the main idea with the help of visuals and graphics that accompany texts.

116A72F0DFE701310E8F68A86D17958E.description: Focus on the overall meaning of the message or text to avoid stumbling on unknown words and expressions.

116A2E30DFE701310E8E68A86D17958E.description: Derive meaning from simple messages and texts using listening, reading and viewing strategies.

comments: Learners comprehend the main idea and relevant details in a variety of age-appropriate live, written and recorded messages; personal anecdotes; and narratives in the language. They understand and interpret authentic texts ranging from articles in contemporary magazines, newspapers and Internet sources to children's stories and classical literary texts. Learners derive meaning through the use of listening, viewing and reading strategies. Learners reinforce and expand their knowledge across disciplines as they acquire information and distinctive viewpoints directly through authentic print, non-print and digital language and culture sources.
Communicate in languages other than English, both in person and via technology.
